Chelsea begin moving pieces for 2018 summer with another minor transfer



Chelsea have agreed the sale of their longest serving player, according to a report in The Sun.

Goalkeeper Matej Delac join in 2010, before even Gary Cahill or Thibaut Courtois even signed. Now, after almost a decade of loans to small teams dotted around Europe, he will leave to join Danish Superliga side AC Horsens.

The 25 year old never looked like making it at Stamford Bridge, and was never even registered in the Premier League squad for the team even after so many years.

He did feature in a friendly in 2014, but has otherwise been out of sight and out of mind all over Europe.

At first it was work permit issues that were preventing him from getting a shot in the side, but before long it was clear that he was just being loaned out to improve his value.

Now it looks as though he will finally be moved on, although the fee we receive is unlikely to justify those ten loans.

ITALY'S FIRST FOOTBALL NEWS SITE

Serie A clubs eye bargain moves as Chelsea set for summer revolution

Chelsea are not likely to qualify for the next Champions League. The Blues have been struggling through the current campaign and last week-end’s defeat against Tottenham was probably the last possibility Chelsea wasted to return in race to qualify for Europe’s elite competition.

Following the fiasco of this season, The Telegraph predicts several Blues will leave Stamford Bridge in the summer. The likes of Thibaut Courtois, Eden Hazard, Pedro and Giroud are in fact expected to pack their suitcases and move elsewhere in the summer.

The same goes for David Luiz and Cesc Fabregas. According to reports in England they are also likely to leave Chelsea at the end of the season. The contracts of both players, however, expire in 2019 and that could make them interesting targets for top Serie A clubs that will be looking for midfield and defensive reinforcements in the summer.

Less than one year ago both Juventus and AC Milan were linked with a summer move for Cesc Fabregas.

Chelsea make initial enquiries about taking Leonardo Jardim from Monaco

Chelsea have made initial enquiries about the possibility of securing the services of Leonardo Jardim from AS Monaco to replace Antonio Conte, according to Yahoo Sport.

Jardim is into his fourth season at Ligue 1 Monaco and is apparently attracting the interest of Chelsea, who look keen to replace Antonio Conte after a disappointing season for the Blues.

Chelsea are currently eight points adrift of a top four spot in the Premier League and therefore look set to having to settle for Europa League football next season, missing out on a Champions League spot.

Jardim has had a successful four years at the helm of Monaco, guiding them to a surprise Ligue 1 title last season ahead of Paris Saint Germain.

The 43-year-old is under contract at Monaco until the summer of 2020, having recently extended his contract with the club. His deal with the French side is reported to be worth a staggering €4 million a year but it does have a €7.5 million buy-out clause in it

General word in France is that Monaco intend to replace Leonardo Jardim, despite signing a new contract recently, with Maurizio Sarri. Meaning Jardim could be available this summer.

Frank Leboeuf - “It's a lack of respect for the fans & the club, both on the manager's part, because he's already packed his bags, but also from the players. We saw it with Mourinho, it seemed like some of the players were almost losing on purpose so the manager can get sacked.
"I knew a team that was hungry for trophies, wanted to win. Now, it doesn't seem that way. One year you win the league, the next it's a mess."

Monaco made an offer to Napoli Coach Maurizio Sarri, according to reports, but he’s focused on the Scudetto race.

The tactician has an €8m release clause in his contract, and talks over a new deal have been postponed until the end of the season.

Now Corriere dello Sport is reporting that that Monaco approached Sarri’s agent, proposing a €6m multi-year contract.

Current Coach Leandro Jardim could leave at the end of the season, with Chelsea among the clubs linked with him.

However, the newspaper reports that Sarri made it clear that he is fully focused on the Scudetto race, so no negotiation ever took place.

【now.com體育】曼城球星奇雲迪布尼透露，在車路士年代僅與時任領隊摩連奴談過兩次。
曼城球星奇雲迪布尼（Kevin De Bruyne）在2013/14球季效力車路士時，與現任曼聯領隊摩連奴共事半年，惜沒能獲得對方重用，聯賽僅得2次出場機會。周六曼徹斯特打吡爆發在即，當問到與摩帥關係時，迪布尼說：「我們的關係很疏離，但我一向不是常跟領隊説話的人。」 兩人半年談過兩次話，「第1次，是他知道我打算夏天轉投多蒙特；第2次，我坦白相告離開對自己有好處，我想有更多出場機會。」迪布尼說。摩帥似乎懂得跟自己欣賞的球員溝通，但未能完全發掘其他球員的潛質。 此外，曼城周中歐聯8強作客慘負利物浦0:3後，周四隨即恢復操練備戰周末大戰，球員在訓練時笑容滿面，似乎沒有受到大敗所影響。未來5天對曼城很關鍵，關乎能否提前獲得聯賽冠軍，以及下周歐聯次回合能否反勝利物浦。

Speculations about the future of Massimiliano Allegri are intensifying. The Italian manager features in the front pages of every sport paper out in Italy this morning. According to Tuttosport the Italian is keen to remain at Juventus and snub a move to Chelsea as he wants to coach a Champions League club next season.

There are, however several other reports linking the Italian with a move away from Juventus. According to Il Corriere dello Sport Abramovich has put Allegri on top of his shortlist to replace Conte who will be sacked at the end of the current campaign.

​According to the report, Allegri could be offered € 14 million-a-year, the same salary of José Mourinho at Manchester United. The Italian is expected to get Chelsea’s top stars back on track after the last disappointing campaign.

The Italian paper also reports that the Juventus boss would like three of his current players to follow him at Stamford Brige: the likes of Federico Bernardeschi, Miralem Pjanic and Rodrigo Bentancur would become summer transfer targets for Chelsea if Allegri moves to South West London in the summer.

Chelsea might have moved a step closer to appointing Maurizio Sarri today, as the Italian’s contract negotiations with Napoli have reportedly fallen through.

Due to frustrations between the manager and the board, it seems Sarri may be on the way out. With the club’s unwillingness to spend large somes of money, the coach may take his talents elsewhere.

Enter, stage-right, Chelsea Football Club. As the team splutter to a Europa League finish, owner Roman Abramovich is reportedly looking to move on from Antonio Conte, who is approaching the end of his second season at Stamford Bridge.

Despite the former Italian national team manager’s Premier League title a year ago, it appears that won’t be enough to save his job.

With Sarri a name whispered around even before this contract standoff, those voices are sure to grow ever-louder.

Antonio Conte reaffirms his commitment to Chelsea, saying his team's struggles are affecting his sleep



Antonio Conte has dismissed the theory that he is counting down to his Chelsea pay-off by claiming he is “angry” about the season and is struggling to sleep with his team on course to miss out on Champions League qualification.

Following the defeat to Tottenham Hotspur that has left Chelsea with a mountain to climb to finish in the top four of the Premier League, Conte’s former Juventus team-mate Gianluca Vialli said the Italian “cannot wait to leave” Stamford Bride.

Conte, though, revealed he has not spoken to Vialli since dining with him last year and insisted he is not hoping to be sacked – even though it could land him around £9million in compensation.

“Those who know me very well, they know me, they know that in this moment I am very angry,” said Conte. “I am very sad for this situation. Those who know me very well know I am trying to put all of myself to change this situation because I have great responsibility.

“I feel great responsibility for my work, for my family, for everything. I repeat, when I go to my house, it is not that I am relaxed but I know that I gave everything and I am giving everything for this club. 120 per cent every day, every day. Sometimes, it is very difficult to sleep with these types of problems.”

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/04/06/antonio-conte-reaffirms-commitment-chelsea-saying-teams-struggles/
